00051 #ifndef LOADER_H
00052 #define LOADER_H
00053 
00054 #include <stdio.h>
00055 
00056 #include "host.h"
00057 #include "misc.h"
00058 #include "machine.h"
00059 #include "regs.h"
00060 #include "memory.h"
00061 #include "thread.h"
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * This module implements program loading.  The program text (code) and
00065  * initialized data are first read from the program executable.  Next, the
00066  * program uninitialized data segment is initialized to all zero's.  Finally,
00067  * the program stack is initialized with command line arguments and
00068  * environment variables.  The format of the top of stack when the program
00069  * starts execution is as follows:
00070  *
00071  * 0x7fffffff    +----------+
00072  *               | unused   |
00073  * 0x7fffc000    +----------+
00074  *               | envp     |
00075  *               | strings  |
00076  *               +----------+
00077  *               | argv     |
00078  *               | strings  |
00079  *               +----------+
00080  *               | envp     |
00081  *               | array    |
00082  *               +----------+
00083  *               | argv     |
00084  *               | array    |
00085  *               +----------+
00086  *               | argc     |
00087  * regs_R[29]    +----------+
00088  * (stack ptr)
00089  *
00090  * NOTE: the start of envp is computed in crt0.o (C startup code) using the
00091  * value of argc and the computed size of the argv array, the envp array size
00092  * is not specified, but rather it is NULL terminated, so the startup code
00093  * has to scan memory for the end of the string.
00094  */
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * program segment ranges, valid after calling ld_load_prog()
00098  */
00099 
00100 
00101 /* register simulator-specific statistics */
00102 void
00103 ld_reg_stats(struct thread_t * core, struct stat_sdb_t *sdb);   /* stats data base */
00104 
00105 /* load program text and initialized data into simulated virtual memory
00106    space and initialize program segment range variables; reutrns 1 if
00107    program is an eio trace */
00108 int
00109 ld_load_prog(
00110        struct thread_t * core,
00111        char *fname,             /* program to load */
00112              int argc, char **argv,     /* simulated program cmd line args */
00113              char **envp);      /* simulated program environment */
00114 
00115 /* reload/reset a core's execution to the beginning of it's EIO trace file. */
00116 void
00117 ld_reload_prog(struct thread_t * core);
00118 
00119 #endif /* LOADER_H */
